heading: Unmatched Donimoes
description: is a puzzle I designed where you have to slide all the dominoes into a rectangular shape, without sliding any matching numbers next to each other. (1 player, double-six dominoes)

heading: Capturing Donimoes
description: is a puzzle I designed where you have to collect all the dominoes by sliding matching numbers next to each other.  (1 player, double-six dominoes)

heading: Mirror Donimoes
description: is a puzzle I designed where pawns walk around on top of the dominoes. (1 player, double-six dominoes, 4 pawns)

heading: Tetradominoes
description: is a game I designed where you play matching dominoes in a grid, then try to play the tetromino shapes on top. (1-4 players, double-six dominoes, 7 cardboard tetrominoes, and some beads, buttons, or coins)

heading: Bee Donimoes
description: is a puzzle race game I designed where a swarm of dice bring nectar back to the hive. (1-6 players, double-six dominoes, 6 dice, and a timer)

heading: Domino Finder
description: is a memory game I designed where you have to find the treasure domino without falling in a trap. (2-4 players, double-six dominoes, pawns, and 2 dice)

heading: Mountains and Valleys
description: is a solitaire game by Sid Sackson where you have to lay out a map that you can hike on. I added a cooperative version, and adapted it from paper, pencil, and dice to use dominoes. (1-4 players, double-six dominoes)

heading: Domino Runners
description: is based on board games by Roland Siegers, where your runners run across a grid of dominoes, dropping checkers and trying to capture your opponent's checkers. (2 players, double-six dominoes, and checkers)

heading: Fujisan
description: is a solitaire game by James Droscha where you help four Shinto priests climb to the peak of Mount Fuji. I found 20 layouts that are much more challenging than usual. (1 player, double-six dominoes, and four pawns)

heading: Cobra Paw
description: is a quick-reaction game by Derek Weston. (2-4 players, double-six dominoes, and two dice)

heading: All Fives
description: is a traditional dominoes game, where you score points by making the ends add up to a multiple of five. (2-4 players, double-six dominoes)

heading: Classic Puzzles
description: where you have to lay out dominoes in a given pattern to meet some goal, popularized by Henry Ernest Dudeney. Also includes Dominosa by O.S. Adler. (1 player, double-six dominoes, paper and pencil)
